summary: This is a superseding indictment filed in the Southern District of New York charging Ghislaine Maxwell with six counts related to the sexual exploitation of minors. It details her alleged role in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating the abuse of multiple minor girls by Jeffrey Epstein between 1994 and 1997, and includes charges of perjury for false statements made under oath in 2016.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Charged with conspiracy, enticement, transportation of minors, and perjury for her alleged role in facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of minor girls.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as the primary abuser of minor girls, with Maxwell allegedly assisting him. He is named as a co-conspirator in the indictment.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Signed the superseding indictment as the Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: Described as having a personal and professional relationship; intimate partners and closest associates who conspired to entice and transport minors for sexual abuse.
Maxwell was paid by Epstein to manage his various properties during the time of the alleged conspiracy.

events.title: Conspiracy and Abuse Period
events.description: Maxwell and Epstein allegedly conspired to entice and transport minor girls across state lines to Epstein's residences for the purpose of sexual abuse.

events.title: Minor Victim-1 Travel from Florida to New York
events.description: Minor Victim-1 was enticed to travel from Florida to New York for the purpose of being sexually abused at Epstein's New York residence.

events.title: Massage of Minor Victim-2 in New Mexico
events.description: Maxwell provided an unsolicited, topless massage to Minor Victim-2 at Epstein's New Mexico residence as part of grooming.

events.title: First Perjurious Deposition
events.description: During a civil deposition, Maxwell gave false testimony under oath, denying knowledge of Epstein's scheme to recruit underage girls and claiming limited awareness of his sexual activities.

events.title: Second Perjurious Deposition
events.description: During a civil deposition, Maxwell gave false testimony under oath, denying awareness of sex toys at Epstein's home, denying giving massages, and falsely limiting the scope of Epstein's sexual partners.

locations: Upper East Side, Manhattan, New York (Epstein's New York Residence)
Palm Beach, Florida (Epstein's Palm Beach Residence)
Santa Fe, New Mexico (Epstein's New Mexico Ranch)
Southern District of New York (jurisdiction for the indictment)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell is charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to entice and transport minors across state and international lines for sexual abuse from at least 1994 to 1997.
The indictment specifies three minor victims (identified as Minor Victim-1, -2, and -3) who were as young as 14 years old when groomed and abused.
Maxwell's alleged methods included befriending victims, normalizing sexual conduct, being present during abuse, and encouraging victims to massage Epstein.
Maxwell is charged with two counts of perjury for false statements made under oath in 2016 depositions, where she denied knowledge of Epstein's activities and her own involvement.
The abuse and grooming allegedly occurred at multiple Epstein-owned properties in New York, Florida, and New Mexico, as well as at Maxwell's London residence.
